short_summary: Provision of Indigenous programs and Elder services to the offender population is expected. The contractor must provide spiritual and ceremonial services to Indigenous offenders.
description: The contractor must provide spiritual and ceremonial services to Indigenous offenders. The contractor must be recognized by their community as an Elder / Cultural Advisor within that community. The contractor must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous people. The contractor must be able to provide counseling and guidance according to the traditions and teachings of their own community and be familiar with and able to conduct a variety of ceremonies with a focus on healing.

full_summary:
### Tender Announcement - Elder Services

#### Background
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities for a contract to provide Elder services to Indigenous offenders in correctional facilities. The CSC aims to provide programs and opportunities to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders, and this contract is part of its efforts to achieve this goal.

#### Objectives
The objective of this contract is to provide Indigenous offenders with cultural and spiritual support, promoting healing and reintegration into their communities. The Contractor must provide the following services:

* Ceremonial and spiritual services, including counseling, teachings, and traditional ceremonies.
* Advice and guidance on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices to staff and management.
* Case management services, including participation in case conferences and providing information to the Case Management Team.

#### Requirements
To be eligible, the Contractor must demonstrate the following criteria:

* Recognition as an Elder/Cultural Advisor within their community.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous people.
* Familiarity with and ability to conduct various ceremonies with a focus on healing.
* Prior experience working with Indigenous offenders and staff.

#### Procurement Details
* Tender Reference Number: CB-274-51863104
* Procurement Category: SRV
* Procurement Method: Advance Contract Award Notice
* Closure Date: November 8, 2023, 14:00 EST
* UN/SPSC Code: 80171905
* Procurement Description: Cultural and Spiritual Services for Indigenous Offenders

#### Contractor Requirements
* The Contractor must provide services in French and English.
* Security requirements include valid Reliability Status granted by Correctional Services Canada.
* Only Indigenous suppliers who meet the definition of an Indigenous business may submit a statement of capabilities.

#### Evaluation Criteria
Tenders will be evaluated based on the Contractor's ability to meet the minimum essential requirements, including their experience, qualifications, and capacity to perform the services.

#### Contact Information
For further information, contact Kim Lavallée, Regional Supply and Contract Officer, Correctional Service of Canada, located at 250 Montée St-François, Laval, QC H7C, 1S5. Telephone: 514-235-9156, Email: kim.lavallee@csc-scc.gc.ca.

#### Tender Submission
To participate, interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities, which must clearly demonstrate how they meet the advertised requirements. The statement of capabilities must be submitted in writing by the closing
